Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: Micahel C
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference. This hotel has exceeded my expectations by any means. The best part are the amenities. Free breakfast at Doolins (attached to hotel), free and strong wifi, and free passes to the Steve Nash Jim. The Jim is better than any Gold's gym I have worked out in in the Northern Virginia (DC Area). It's all included. The hotel is very centrally located. Short walk to the convention center and Yaletown. I've spent six days here and can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: Room is small but comfortable. Good location in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation, great location”
Reviews.Author: Katie W
Reviews.Content: I stayed for threeights in mid March 2012. The hotel didn't WOW me, but there was nothing wrong with it. Except that my room smelt a little musty - don't know how good the ventilation is. The room was a little on the small side, but the bed was comfortable, staff were friendly and knowledgable, housekeeping did a good job. Free wifi worked well. So overall theres not much to complain about. The Irish pub next door does a roaring trade. The hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to shops, waterfront etc - I even walked back from Vancouver Aquarium - about 4-5kms. They've got lots of brochures for maps, day trips etc.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: Waikatosflyingkiwi
Reviews.Content: Fairly central. Pulling my bag from the Sky Train station in Yaletown I arrived at enterance. Stairs only and doors open outwards automaticly from top of stairs. This would be an issue for those a little unsteady on their feet. Reception friendly and efficient with knowledge of Vancouver. Upgraded as rewards member to room with two king beds. Solo traveller. Scratched my head. Bed comfortable. Room end of passage away from lifts and ice machine. NO noise issue unlike the company's Quality Inn,False Creek hotel where road noise WILL disrupt sleep. Housemaids helpful and friendly. Breakfast included in next door pub. This was good. Price for a hotel downtown excellent.Visited Vancouver 1.5 years ago and streets clean of beggars after the Olympics but now beggars and sleezy sorts are everywhere. Sleeping in doorways and when buying train ticket had on shove his had in my face 'CHANGE'. While in Vancouver try the Yaletown Brewhouse. One of the best brown ales to be had anywhere on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you don't want to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: binky_2012
Reviews.Content: I can't understand why anyone would stay here. Assuming the point of checking into a hotel is to actually sleep at night, then there's no point trying this place. First impressions were great, the location was very central and perfect for our requirements, the staff were friendly and the room was clean, an ok size and had everything you'd expect, there was the kind of traffic noise you'd expect from a downtown hotel, but nothing problematic. After we'd been in the room 5 minutes, the people next door came in. They weren't being noisy but we could hear every single word of their conversation, even when they turned the TV on. It was as though the walls were actually amplifying their conversation! This was clearly going to be a problem so we returned to the desk and were moved to a bigger room in a 'quiet' location for no extra charge. This seemed fine until just after 10pm when incredibly loud music started drifting up from the pub downstairs. This carried on for a few hours, but when it stopped it was replaced by loud singing by drunk people, accompanied by a irregular percussion that we think was coming for the water pipes. The doors have automatic closers on them so that they bang quite loudly, as if that wasn't enough noise and although we were at the opposite end of the corridor from the ice machine, you could hear quite clearly every time someone used it. The chap next door had a nasty cough and snored - not his fault, the the wall amplified every little noise, and every time the person in the room above got up to use the loo the footsteps were like distant thunder. We had booked 2 nights but after one almost completely sleepless night we checked out and went elsewhere. The staff are clearly familiar with the problem and didn't try and charge for the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly the same as last year, just one minor annoyance.”
Reviews.Author: jasonacg
Reviews.Content: One year since my last visit, I booked another stay here. I received a room with the same floor plan as the previous year, one floor directly above last year's room. This room was equipped with a fixture that served as a dresser, with a small refrigerator behind another cabinet. It was nice having this extra storage, but it did make the entryway a little more cramped, particularly with a king-size bed in the room. Since my visit last year, many changes were made to the TV programming offered in the room. While the system has been upgraded to carry HD channels, it resulted in the loss of many of the channels that were previously available, including some local stations. What makes it worse, is that the new channel list that's left in the room, shows about twice as many channels, most of which aren't available at all. When you're trying to "cool down" after playing in the city, it would be nice to have more of an in-room selection. Aside from that little annoyance, the experience was nearly identical to last year. The room was clean and comfortable. The jetted tub is a nice bonus, especially after a long day on the slopes. Again, if you don't like noise at night, this is not the place for you. It's in the heart of the entertainment district. The streets in front of the hotel, will be crowded until well into the night, particularly on Friday and Saturday nights. All in all, it's a good value, for a hotel that's right in the center of everything. There's plenty of entertainment and dining options within walking distance, access to transit within a very short walk, and when the weather is clear, you can even look up Granville Street, and get a glimpse of the spectacular mountains on the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jambo1998
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in November. Upon arrival into Vancouver Airport i took the train downtown(20 minutes) and then found my way to the hotel on foot. just a 10 minute walk along Granville st. Check in was smooth and the staff very friendly,providing me with maps and information for navigating the city. The rooms are very clean if a little compact,but rooms are just for sleeping in! A plentiful,fresh complimentary breakfast was provided in the bar which set me up nicely for the day. I would recommend this hotel to a traveller looking for a good value,central hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: kcweir
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, not for the rooms but for the location. The rooms were very small, but also recently remodeled and clean. We got a great price (less than $100) for the night, and thought it was a good value. The breakfast in the morning wasn't spectacular, but the pub at night was lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Average but great location”
Reviews.Author: Delhigirl8
Reviews.Content: Well this one was an average stay with a flight connection which had gone awry I was stranded in Vancouver and had only some cash left on me. The hotel is a typical B&B so don't expect much here. Just comfortable enough for you to sleep and head out but not to stay....Over all, nothing to write home about. Just great location as you can head out to downtown and return back. Rooms are very small and the bathroom also is very small..unless I was given the lowest category of room. The bar gets very noisy but what was good was the access control in the elevator to get to the rooms as travelling alone I was concerned about my security. The soaps in the bathroom didn't lather! The staff was friendly but unconcerned ... The only good thing was my complimentary airport drop.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do - Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: soccermum_11
Reviews.Content: We were booked into a 2 Queen Bed (and sofa bed) for 3 nights in December. The staff were very friendly, and even on first arriving, the foyer and even room were tidy and clean, but if you want to sleep - don't stay there. There was something stomping around in the air conditioning vents all night and it sounded like bigfoot!!!. The floor slanted as you walked toward the door!!!. Part of the deal was breakfast was included each day - thats ok if you like only bagels, or want to make your own waffles, or have room temperature orange juice or milk. There were a couple of muffins but who knew what was in them. Also if you have anyone in your group under 19, they can't dine in the Irish pub attached to the hotel - you can buy dinner and they give it to you in take out boxes with wooden cuttlery(!!??) to have in the room - the food was really nice, but hard to eat off a coffee table out of boxes. We cancelled our reservation and were out before 11am after the first night. To be fair, they offered another room - but the building would all have the same airconditioning vents!!! They did give a refund of the 2 remaining nights, but at the time I wouldn't have argued - I just wanted out.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: bhs_wpg
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on location and price, and were pleased by many other aspects, not least of which was the staff service. We stayed on the fourth floor, which was very lovely. We were initially placed on the first floor, which had a latent smell of smoke and was not very nice, so we requested a move and they accommodated nicely. The rooms are not big, but nicely appointed. There is a daily buffet breakfast included, server in the pub downstairs. It is a simple self-serve breakfast, including a make-your-own waffles. This will get you going for the day. It is just two blocks walk (south along Granville St) from the closest Canada Line train stop from the airport. Overall I thought it was good value and I would recommend it. Free wifi was good. Nice but small lobby, with lots of brochures. Helpful staff. A stop for the shuttle ski bus to Whistler. Parking beside hotel is convenient, $14/day. Close enough to walk (over the bridge) to Granville Island markets. We stayed with two young kids. Granville Street can be dodgy at night, but by day the area is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: sazzyb8
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and clean and right in the heart of downtown. Don't stay here if you are looking for luxury! They have updated the bathrooms, which was nice. It is simple, clean and comfortable and that's it. No frills. They do provide a dry breakfast - waffles, toast and cereal and it's great for the price, we paid $79 a night so were quite satisfied. The room was cleaned to a very high standard and the beds were the comfiest we've ever had! The room we had was on the very small side but there's only the two of us and we weren't in much to mind. One bone of contention would be the walls. If you have a noisy neighbour then you won't get much sleep. Unfortunately the man next to us was having a 'quiet' night in and it was gross to have to hear that. Other than that we'd definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: Canshy
Reviews.Content: PROS: We booked our Canucks package through this hotel. This is an excellent deal as it includes lower bowl seats (7 rows up from the ice near the home net) and a free continental breakfast at the pub downstairs in addition to accommodations the night of the game. Free breakfast consisted of cereals, muffins, fruit, oatmeal, as well as a waffle making station, orange and apple juices, coffee and hot chocolate etc. Very nice. Within walking distance to Rogers arena/BC place and located RIGHT in the heart of Granville. A variety of pubs and clubs and shopping options nearby. This was our third time staying at this hotel. Rooms are tidy, beds are comfortable. Staff at check in was nice, especially a young man named Patrick who, when we arrived hours before check-in was quick to put our bags in storage so we could explore the city. Efficient check in and out. CONS: I noticed the rooms looked a little dingier than they did a few years ago (they need a fresh coat of paint-- badly). They have updated the tv's and have some flat screens in the king rooms, they could have went the extra mile by attempting to hide the wires and cables that are attached to the tvs. Bath tubs are small. Walls are super thin-- we spent the first night listening to the neighbors having sex-- NOT my idea of a good time. They did give our group a complimentary upgrade the first night from a two double bed room to a double bed with a pullout couch room.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT inn!”
Reviews.Author: kiwiiiiii
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel, super helpful staff, great location - right in the city centre and above two excellent bars/clubs. Surprisingly it is not noisy (stayed on 4th floor). The beds are so lovely and really comfortable I could've stayed in there for days.. Highly recommend this hotel, I've stayed in a few diff ones (around this price range) in Vancouver and this is my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hengelo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights. The hotel is located in the heart of the shopping and entertainment district. Helpful staff, clean room, although with decoration which reminds you of the seventies. Breakfast in the pub, connected to the hotel. Fair price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay !”
Reviews.Author: flipflop22Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at the Comfort downtown. Nice upgrade, thank you. Room very spacious, with 3 windows - alot of light (a little too much from Granville) but still enjoyed opening the windows. Fireplace & 2 person whirlpool . These are the most comfortable king beds !! Very clean & great Staff. Can't beat the location for walking. Weekends are very lively & noisy so be sure to request a room on higher floor. Can't understand how people comment on the breakfast, rare to find a downtown hotel who even offers a free breakfast, yes, it's basic but a great start. We look forward to sitting in the beautiful pub having a coffee & relaxing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cozy Room, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was within walking distance of the SkyTrain (public transit), tour bus stop (recommended by the front desk) and Canada Place cruise ship terminal. The staff was very friendly and helpful with providing tourist information about the local area. The room was rather small, but that's to be expected for the location so close to the action in any city. The bathroom was functional, but the sink was on a pedestal and had very little counter space. With 4 adults, there was very little room for storage. The included breakfast was good and included many grains like danishes, breads, and waffles, but could use more fruits to round out the selection. Our room was on the 2nd floor and facing Granville street, but the noise from the street never disturbed us. The included Wifi was very convenient since our 3G service on our cell phones didn't work (we are from Long Island, NY, USA), so the hotel was the only place to get an internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “not up to standard comfort inn”
Reviews.Author: trtl29
Reviews.Content: we usually stay at either comfort, days or best westerns b/c we can count on the consistency of clean, well appointed rooms and usually an included breakfast. However, this comfort inn, although the room was clean, the staff extremely helpful and friendly, the breakfast more than satisfactory, did not meet up to those standards. the room was on the small side, although it did have a very comfortable bed, and the bathroom did have a spa tub. Having just gotten off a ship from a cruise, the slanting floor of the room made us feel as though we were still at sea. When we closed one drawer of the bureau, another would slide open - comedy show! The walls need a paint job and if you are a light sleeper, the sounds rising from the pub downstairs may keep you up (we were on the 4th floor and still able to hear). the location is convenient for good walks and to the bus stops. The price is on the high side for a comfort inn, but compared to others in the area, it is most reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, cozy and clean room”
Reviews.Author: Dinesh R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the middle of the downtown core. The staff were nice and helpful and the facilities on site were great. The rooms were small, but clean and cozy. The breakfast included in the package was pretty basic though, wish they had a better spread. But the best part was being able to walk to anywhere within downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: nancy f
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights over Labor Day weekend. First of all, the location is great. There are a ton of shops and places to eat within walking distance. I assume this only happens on the weekend, but Granville Street gets blocked off and it becomes one large party since there are a bunch of clubs and bars nearby. The room itself is standard. The sheets are clean and the bathroom is roomy. The room itself is kind of short though, not leaving much space between the wall and the bed. It can get noisy at night but make sure to close your windows and it's not too bad. I think the noise within the hotel is worse since the walls are on the thin side. I did appreciate the heavy curtain on the window that kept the room dark in the morning. It comes with a basic continental breakfast and parking is available just outside the hotel for a fee. There is a computer in the lobby that is free for guests to use. The rate is decently priced, but due to taxes, it gets hiked up quite a bit. Overall, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “If your gonna spend $200 a night on a room...”
Reviews.Author: ElleVancouver11
Reviews.Content: go stay at The Sheraton just up the street. It is a much nicer hotel and not on such a noisy, dirty corner. You can tell they tried to fix up the rooms and they were really small but okay to put your head down for one night. They have key entry in the elevator but the stairs are right beside it so what's the point? The sales manager I talked to said we would get "full comp'd breakfast" but it was a continental breakfast. FULL breakfast means you get to order a hot meal, not cold hard boiled eggs and make yourself waffles! The front facade and lobby are badly in need of a facelift. Doolin's Pub downstairs gets really noisy at night as does Granville. Would I stay here again...nope...for $200. I can find a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location, hotel and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: BellaChristinaMarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value, although slightly older in style it was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is very conveniently located and I was very impressed with the breakfast spread which also allowed you to make your own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “good if you just need a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: anaest
Reviews.Content: We booked direct with the hotel, got a fairly good price, by Vancouver standard. The location is fairly central, can easily catch bus no 50 which run along Granville street. The bus 06 stopped almost right outside the hotel too. We walked from the hotel to Canada Place, also walked to the foot of Hornby to take the Aquabus to Granville island. we booked the family room with two queen beds plus sofabed but the room was really cramp, we practically have to climb over our suitcases to move around. However it was clean and functional. The noise coming from the pub and the other rooms can be a problem but we were too tired to be bothered for long. The breakfast was simple but adequate. It is alright if you just need a centrally located place to sleep, like we did. We only came back late at night both nights just to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - would not stay again due to location”
Reviews.Author: Twickers68
Reviews.Content: Not a great location if you have a teenager with you. Not very nice to walk about at night. Very few locations to eat. They give you 25% off before 7 pm at the Irish Pub where you have your breakfast. But that was useless as we had a 14 year old with us. Shame as it was very limited to what we could eat. Ended up in Nandos - one of my least favourite places. Free wifi. Beware - steps up from the street to reception with no assistance with cases. Breakfast buffet adequate although seating was a free for all with very few tables set up for four people. Did love the people make their lunch too!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price”
Reviews.Author: jengarner99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to our Alaskan cruise. The room was small but had a wonderful jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. Clean and great for a short stay where you will only be in the room to sleep. Within walking distance (less than a half mile) to Granville Island aquabus and an easy public bus ride to Stanley park. Nice basic continental breakfast in the adjacent pub/restaurant which is also a great place to eat lunch or dinner. Beware of the weekends, the nearby streets are packed with people bar hopping. You may want to ask for a room away from the pub. During the week is much quieter. Great little place for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, great location and reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: kasclark
Reviews.Content: We needed a place downtown, close to the conference we were attending. Of all the places we found, the Comfort Inn had the best price, so we booked it for a week. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the staff was helpful. They have free Wi-Fi and an extensive breakfast in the pub next door. All in all this was a great stay for a good price. Be prepared that this place is really in the heart of the night-life area, so it can be a bit noisy. However, our room was well insulated and we had no trouble falling asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: TuesdaysChild79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay if you just want somewhere to sleep and are not fussed about noise. The walls are paper thin. Other than that, clean and tidy. Comfortable. Shower in my room a bit faulty, but once you got it going it was great. Also TV a bit faulty. Very central location, so that was brilliant. Would consider staying here again, if I was doing more sightseeing. Not if I wanted a relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CarissaB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a girl's getaway with my mom and sister for 4 nights. The room was nothing special, but it was big enough, and clean. The price seemed pretty good compared to other hotels I checked out that were also downtown, and this appeared to be the only one that also offered complimentary breakfast (boiled eggs, toast, waffles, fruit and muffins). The staff seemed friendly enough, though we didn't have much interaction with them. The location is perfect for anyone hoping to immerse themselves in Vancouver's downtown shopping/eating/nightlife seen. Although the hotel was amidst several nightclubs, there was very little street noise (probably something to do with the fact that there was about 1 food of space between windowpanes). Overall, I would definitely stay here again when visiting downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Cool-son
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April during a quick weekend getaway. Fantastic location, we were able to walk everywhere. We were not happy with our room the first night on one of the lower floors due to noise and smell, but the hotel happily switched us for the remaining nights the next morning to a higher floor and the new room was great. Continental breakfast in the pub was great! This hotel is not the fanciest, but it was great value for its location. I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice and Value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Kenoradave
Reviews.Content: We were in Vancouver for the marathon on May 1. Stayed five nights in hotel. Excellent value, view of English Bay from the 5th floor, windows that opened. Take a room on the back side away from the traffic on the Granville Bridge. Good underground parking. Restaurant hours were spotty but there are lots of places nearby. Walk over bridge to the island. Close to Seawall walk around False Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: putnik84
Reviews.Content: Great location, extra friendly staff. We stay 4 in room with two double beds and it was more than enough place. Breakfast was served in the pub and it was perfect. Especially I like think that you can make pancakes with maple syrup by own . :)

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, but Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Doug-62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vancouver Comfort Inn Downtown for two nights (May 19th and May 20th). We selected this property as it was close to One Canada Place and we were to board a cruise ship on May 21st. We were in room 405, which is on the fourth floor. The room was acceptable, but some of the furniture was showing some wear. There were some cigarette burns on the desk. However, the room was clean and ready upon check-in. I have posted pictures of the room. If I had to use one word to describe the room, it would be small. I think the room was smaller than the cabin we ended up having on the cruise ship, and definitely smaller than the ones shown on their webpage. The property is older and has obviously been renovated. I would say they are doing the best with the building they have. Also, the view out our window left something to be desired. However, it faced away from the street, so we did not hear any noise from traffic. There was a continental breakfast available each morning – which was served in the Irish pub that was also located on the property. It was standard fare – a good start to a morning. Front desk staff was helpful and willing to answer our questions. We were able to store our bags at no charge upon check-out when we learned our cruise ship would be boarding 5 hours late. Overall, a good stay. We found most hotels in the area were quite pricey and we were looking to save some money. Also, we spent most of the time out and about exploring, so the small accommodations were not too bothersome. I would give this property consideration if planning a trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “it's a very good value central vancouver hotel with a very good pub”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: Hey, it's central vancouver, so a few weirdo's should be expected, this hotel is clean, well priced, recently updated and very well managed with good staff and the attached pub is very good. It's currently my favorite downtown Vancouver hotel

Reviews.Title: “"Suite deal"”
Reviews.Author: flipflop22Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Wow, was upgraded to a "business suite" on the 4th floor - Thank you !!!! Didn't want to leave the room and the most comfy king bed. Fireplace, fridge, microwave, free WIFI - couldn't ask for much more. We often stay at the Comfort downtown as the location is perfect - easy walking downtown Robson St and lots of excitement on Granville plus breakfast served in the Pub downstairs. Internet in lobby as well. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Location”
Reviews.Author: Malnat1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business trip. Was given room on first floor and was kept awake but music until around 1.00pm each night. Staff friendly and helpful, room clean but lights not working properly. Had to ask desk staff to remove a drunk tramp from the entrance to the hotel, so that I could get in, actually had to enter the hotel via the Pub in the end. This hotel may be okay for a 1 night stay but would definitely not recommend any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie-w86
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose this hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor and booking.com and I'm very pleased we stayed there. We had a great stay (5 nights) at the hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I emailed before arriving asking for a room away from the pub and we were given a quiet room on the 5th floor. We arrived early and they stored our bags until the room was ready. The room was good - clean, spacious with a huge and comfortable bed. The only disappointment was no fridge to keep our food cold. Wi-fi was available at no extra cost. The breakfast included at the pub downstairs was great - muffins, fruit, juice, waffles, bagels, bread, cereal. Lots to choose from. A Nesters supermarket was very near by so we could stock up if needed. The hotel is in a brilliant location - all the sights in Vancouver were within walking distance and we had no problems - and train station was easily accessible - only a few blocks away. I would definitely recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: sopor81
Reviews.Content: We took an overnight bus from Banff to Vancouver and arrived at the Downtown Inn pretty early (10am). We asked front desk if by any chance our room was free. It wasn't but they must have noticed our tiredness and upgraded us the a king bed room and let us in straight away! Even a late check out was no problem (we were one of those annoying guests!). The neighbourhood is a bit noisy, but hey it is in the middle of downtown in a big city. The breakfast seemed a bit unorganized and not prepared for that many guests. But overall good!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but in a great position”
Reviews.Author: cloud_traveller
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Downtown is located at the very heart of Vancouver, and this is probably its major quality. The area is the centre of the entertainment district but since I had read about this and the pub downstairs, I asked for a room at the back and it was quiet. The room itself was quite big for myself alone (king-sized bed included!), although the bathroom was really tiny and had no storage space for my toiletries - I can't imagine two people's stuff in there! Besides, the heating system was rather mysterious and the room was rather cold. The staff were very helpful and if you don't have your own computer (the free wi-fi works properly), there's a computer with its own printer for guests in the lobby. My package included a free newspaper everyday but I didn't receive a single paper in three days. Breakfast was basic but the only thing that doesn't really work about it is the location. It is served in the extremely dimly-lit pub downstairs, and such a dark environment is not my idea of a a breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: rosners
Reviews.Content: Didn't have high expectations after our first hotel in downtown Vancouver, but this was a very pleasant surprise. Firstly, we were upgraded and our room for 4 was enormous. Two queen-sized beds plus a leather couch that could have opened up as another bed. Seems that the bathroom was a bit of an afterthought as they'd not provided shelves of any kind. Coffee maker provided in rooms and excellent breakfast was included (in pub downstairs). Staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Definitely would recommend this place. Very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room for the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: decahedron
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Downtown Vancouver BC for one night on the third floor for a trip to write an exam. The exam was at 1:30pm so I stayed in the room until checkout at 11 am. The room was clean and the jet tub was a nice surprise. Of my peers who stayed at other hotels in the area I paid the least for a room with the exception of those who chose the YWCA. The room was small but suitable for two. The bed was good and even had comfortable pillows, a rare find for me in a hotel. During the day there was some traffic noise but not unbearable. At one time there was a strange buzzing which interrupted my study but I don't know if it came from inside the hotel or out, it lasted only a few minutes. Other than some late night revelers returning to their rooms, early in the morning from the bars (a brief interruption), the stay was quiet. I would stay at this hotel again. It is a good bargain. Be aware that watching a movie costs $12. There is no gym so I went to the Fitness World about 2 blocks away and was charged $22 for the visit.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what it says on the tin...”
Reviews.Author: app2011
Reviews.Content: cheap, clean, comfortable and good showers. exactly what you want from a comfort inn and a little bit extra i think. lobby/front needs a lick of paint, but the rooms surprisingly large and good quality. there's a fairly loud pub downstairs, but even on the first floor we couldn't hear it. definitely recommend for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: wedgie78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for 2 nights, on different occasions . Our first room was a standard double which was nice but a tad small, the upside was we did have a jacuzzi in the bathroom. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the room. On our second stay we got upgraded to a twin double room and this was very roomy. It had a couch, microwave and plenty of room for our baby to crawl around. We didn't have a jacuzzi in this room. The front office staff were helpful and friendly. We did have breakfast included in our room rate and was serviced downstairs in the Irish pub. The continental breakfast was good it was open from 7am-10am. I found certain parts of Granville street a little dodgy. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and Nesters supermarket and IGA near by. Paul's Stirfry restaurant is very good, which is a stones throw from the hotel. The train station is 3 blocks away. The free high speed internet was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal! Nice and helpful Staff !”
Reviews.Author: mathas
Reviews.Content: Lived here for two weeks after the Olympic Games. Rooms are small but clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. Sometimes you can see a 5* proffessionality like helping out with luggage, concierge, wake up service things like that... Average breakfast in a nice Pub downstairs. Make sure you get a room as off the 3rd floor because off the loud music unless you re not in the club during weekdays and weekend to partying. Great location! Pet friendly ( you pay for stay not for night). All in all a good and cheap alternativ compared to the high priced hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Clean and Central”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters
Reviews.Content: No frills - clean and cheap - and a decent location - ask for a higher floor as there is a Irish pub attached to the hotel. The pub is a nice place to have a drink if you have the time..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SYYOW
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the price. It was one of the more affordable hotels in Vancouver. The staff were ok. We arrived and the girl in the lobby was too busy with her own things and didn't bother to greet us. Well, I cant expect too much right. Breakfast was decent. Too much carbo for my liking. I booked the standard room and it was really very very small. The TV had to hang from the wall and our window overlooked the apartments in the next block. At least, the rooms were clean. Overall, the stay was ok for the location and price. Don't expect too much from the un-enthusiastic stuff and you are ok.

Reviews.Title: “It's ALL about VALUE !”
Reviews.Author: webpilot1
Reviews.Content: Two day stay. Building looks better than in Google Streets. Road construction in GS long since completed. Eager to please desk staff. Room better than expected. Clean. Steer noise UNAVOIDABLE in the city ! Dumpster divers 20 meters from parking at most hours. Just hope we don't join them in this economy. Irish Pub downstairs audible, but not much. Saturday night sidewalks stay busy all night. Lots of clubs. Good location for tourists. Quiet arrives at 4 am. Continental Breakfast good. Room has phone/ iPod charger/speaker set. Chinese fellow at desk in PM is service personified. Excellent. Price for Vancouver is very competitive. Book it Dano ! !

Reviews.Title: “start to finish everything was perfect, did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: pmarshall12
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights a friday and saturday and didn't experience any of the noise problems I expected to. For such a great rate and great location i was extremly happy with the room, entire building including rooms was very up to date. All staff were very friendly helpful and knowledgable special consideration to Jesse on the front desk made my weekend much more enjoyable. I have worked in hotel industry for years and am typically very critical of hotels but I found nothing to criticize. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “In a pinch it will do.”
Reviews.Author: chrispie
Reviews.Content: I just got back from vancouver and i am not picky about places to stay. Everything was booked and it was one of the few to pick from. Positives: Great breakfast in the pub. Negatives: VERY SMALL double beds - they are more like singles, very small room. The room stunk of some sort of cleaner, and so did our friends next door. Only good thing is the location, if your wanting to go out and party - or people watch and don't mind very noisy area this is the place to be, just off of granville. Pub downstairs noisy on the weekend could hear it upstairs. The price after parking included came out to $145.00 for the room, parking lot had a security gaurd which was good as it was not fenced or anything. would i stay here again? if i was in a pinch and couldn't find anything yes, as it includes breakfast, but definately would look for something else first. oh and wifi wasn't the greatest and only one computer in lobby to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.....great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: sapphire10
Reviews.Content: Had a quad room on the 4th floor of this downtown hotel, a short walk from Vancouver's attractions and the trendy Yale area with its many restaurant's. Some of our party found the room noisy and the beds uncomfortable, whilst others found it quiet and comfortable. The breakfasts in the downstairs Doolins bar were plentifull and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nature2gether
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Downtown is located very conveniently on Nelson/Granville St. right in the heart of bustling downtown Vancouver. A perfect place for travelling with the public transport (ideal also to airport, ferry, train and greyhound by nearby Canada Line and Skytrain), shopping and nightlife. Extremely clean rooms, comfortable beds and nice bath. Rooms and facilities (TV, internet, AC) were recently renovated/refurbished, good windows (soundproof/insulated). For a downtown location, the room size is OK, although not spacious. Good breakfast and extremely friendly and efficient hotel staff. Great views at night from street-side rooms to downtown vancouver/skyline. Due to good sound-insulation from new windows, only few downtown noise from outside.

Reviews.Title: “OK but location next to bars is off putting”
Reviews.Author: theproo
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty decent - comfy bed and jacuzzi bath. The location although downtown was located on a bar/club strip making it an interesting walk home. The breakfast is decent but could do with more fresh fruit and perhaps yoghurt rather than having 10 kinds of bread. In terms of value, I think there are better hotels out there. This was the most expensive hotel of its class during my holiday. I got a better class of hotel for slightly less money in Seattle, San Francisco and Sonoma - these are not exactly cheap cities. Tip: The quieter rooms are at the back of the building by the carpark.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, Clean and comfortable room, Great continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pearlgirl22
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vancouver with my parents and we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The location is central to everything in the area. We also enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast in the mornings. It is sufficient with waffles, bagels, muffins, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal and juices. The front desk was very helpful with questions and the lobby computer was useful in setting up a few things for our days in the city. The room itself was kept clean and the beds were comfortable for sleeping. It was plenty of room for the three of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great only if you're into the nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: lkbaker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night after ending our cruise. Easy check in and out. Very helpful staff. Room great for our needs. However, hotel in middle of night club area. Noise from street below could be heard all night. While this isn't the hotel's fault, it should be noted that a good, quality night's rest isn't going to happen here. Otherwise, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: GateClosing
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet Saturday (and maybe Friday) night this is NOT the Hotel for you. It is located in Vancouver Street Party Central. As we arrived from London midday Saturday we got our 6 hours sleep by 2am Sunday so the view of the Street "Theatre" kept us amused until it faded by about 5am when we had our second sleep to get into Pacific Time. Sunday night was fine. We arrived from the Airport via the Sky Train which has two stations within walking and wheeled luggage toting distance of the Hotel. As we got to the front door we were greeted by a friendly porter who helped us with the baggage. Check in was efficient, our room was upgraded to a corner room and within 20 minutes we were checked in and down in the Pub for a couple of pints of jet-lag juice. The Hotel is located a couple of blocks from Yaletown with lots of eating places. The car hire office was also 2 blocks away so very convenient for us when we checked out and started our road trip. Staff were helpful, breakfast was basic but adequate. Pub had a good selection of food but being a "Sports bar" was too noisy for a quiet meal (last week of the Stanley Cup, so max volume Ice Hockey). We got seniors discount rate (60+). Maybe we were lucky but this place worked out very well. Good start to our 3 week road trip of BC and the Rockies.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: LondonForestlondon
Reviews.Content: We had a Cruise Ship tour from Vancouver. We stayed overnight at this hotel. It is walking distance to all shops. About 10 minutes to Canada place by taxi to get to the ship. You also get complementory breakfast

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: nikita023
Reviews.Content: clean and comfy, room was a little small, perfect for 1 person..great location, not too far from anywhere, 4 block walk from sky train depots, 1/2 hr walk to granville island, english bay and stanley park..lots restaurants and eateries close by..would definitely stay there again.. the continental breakfast - very good..lots of variety and very friendly staff both in the pub and in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: gelybene
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel over weekend of January 16. Our experience was average - nothing special - but for the price we received we could not really complain much. Pros: Clean room. Comfortable furniture. Trendy up-to-date decor. convienant parking. free wifi. free breakfast. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Cons: very thin walls (and we had loud neighbors on our sides and above us). Very small rooms, especially in comparison to pictures. Hotel next to a shady alley(there was a fight in it one night with people throwing glass bottles right under our window) Near bars, so noisy at night with sirens.

Reviews.Title: “What You See Is Not What You Get!”
Reviews.Author: Dellboyoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just after New Years following our ski trip for 2 nights, we booked this hotel because we needed accomodation for 2 adults and 3 children and from the reviews and photos on trip advisor it seemed ok until... we opened the door to our room and walked straight into the end of one of the beds they must have taken the photos with and extreme wide angle lens to give the illusion of a large spacious room there was barely enough room to walk around the beds, also the room was on a lean thats right you always felt like you were walking up hill or down hill, to top it of the walls and the floors are paper thin on our last night here the person in the room above was constantly walking around till 3.30am in the morning when after repeated calls to the front desk he finally stoppped Never Again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: Drago1981
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel itself is not too bad(clean, nice staff) we had not the best stay there. Make sure you don't get a room on the 1st floor, because the irish Pub in the lower level is pretty busy and loud. However, th estaff was very cooperative in getting another room for us. The key cards on our door lock worked very, very bad. Most times, the door opened after 10 attempts only. The breakfast offer offers only very few choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not next time....”
Reviews.Author: Clearnight
Reviews.Content: The good first: the room was clean and well tended; the bed and linens were comfortable and warm; the staff were generally helpful and responsive. For simply sleeping this is fine (mind you, I did not stay on the weekend when other reviewers said the pub is in full swing.) Cons: breakfast is served in the downstairs pub; I had a view of an alley and could see through the windows of a run-down boarding house from my window; the elevator was very small; the room was small and had only a small window to open for ventilation; on arrival the hall smelled of Chinese food (which would have been fine if it had been mine:) ; my room was not ready when I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Sanpal
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this pet friendly hotel, while in Vancouver attending an event. Our party included 4 adults(2 of them mature) 2 teens and 2 dogs and we required a hotel that was convenient to our venue.The rooms were a bit small but comfortable, very clean, and fairly quiet. The staff were helpful and very friendly. The stairs at the front entrance could be a problem for a disabled person. Shopping, the Vancouver Public Library, the art gallery, the Orpheum Theatre, etc are all nearby. Because we could not eat in the pub with the teens, we had to search out a place for a late meal. We walked along Granville and found Adonis Greek Taverna where we enjoyed a great meal for extremely reasonable prices. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was fine with the usual cereal, muffins, waffles, fruit, toast, etc.. Overall, everyone in our party was quite satisfied, although the hotel is not really geared for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying again”
Reviews.Author: flipflop22Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, comfy beds, a little noisy when the bar lets out but the double set of windows solves that - great idea !!! Nice simple breakfast served in the morning - very relaxed atmosphere Close to Robson Street and lively Granville Street Can't wait to stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice! Would return.”
Reviews.Author: Curt67
Reviews.Content: Well located downtown. Very good free breakfast. We were able to print our boarding passes with the computer located in the lobby, fireplace in the lobby, clean hotel, the cleaning ladies are doing a great job, flat screen TV. Room was a bit small and there was no fridge in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Nights”
Reviews.Author: tedtoop
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general is quite good with breakfast served in the onsight Irish pub, nothing to shout about, no hot food apart from waffles, mainly a bog standard continental bread and cheese job. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms a good size. The main problem was the noise outside that went on until three or four in the morning when people were turning out of the nightclub next door. It was screaming, shouting and swearing all night, and the continious wail of police sirens. Weasked to be moved which they obliged us with a room on the top floor at the back which was a lot quieter and at last we managed to get some sieep, unfortunatley we were overlooking the windows of a rundown doss house

Reviews.Title: “Interesting area - Room decent”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this property. Our usual favorite spots closer to BC Place were already booked up several months earlier, so we thought we'd give Comfort Inn a try. Check in went smoothly and we were offered an upgrade since they were sold out and we had booked way in advance. The one bedroom suite was spacious and had a kitchenette area (no stove top) and a seperate bedroom area. The furniture was interesting....can't really explain the decor but there were purple and orange velvet chairs and a brown couch (thought we had a photo-sorry) . This hotel is right on the fringe of a great area and a not so great area. As long as you didn't look out the bedroom window, it was good. Didn't care for the unsecured parking. Also didn't care for the lack of an express check out option. Breakfast was decent though. For the price, you can generally find something in a better area, but obviously it depends on if there are big events....book early!

Reviews.Title: “Looked after us and changed things as we requested. Brekkie-basic.”
Reviews.Author: Adzonian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite decent for a 3 -star hotel. At first, we found that they put us in a tiny double room contrary to the pictures we saw when booking. Considering we were staying 14nts comfort was paramount so we were pleased when the manager moved us to another room after our complaints. However room two was right alongside some road works taking place, we were notified and given earplugs so it wasn't too bad. Still not fully satisfied as there was no fridge we told the manager again, she said that when a room becomes available she would move us somewhere better....Boy did she move us, to one of the executive suites! So I guess all the complaining and requesting really pays off. She was very polite and helpful. Overall breakfast was a let down as there was not much variety but for that price whose complaining! Finally you get a couple of free passes for the local club nite at the Doolins pub, this should come with a warning as the doorman on one of the nights was rather rude,he thought he would take a look at us and guess what 'music' we would like and offer his unwanted recommendations to local bars! So watch out if you do not look like the style of music you like!!! Overall a good hotel, clean and comfy (in the end).

Reviews.Title: “descent location but very nice room =)”
Reviews.Author: harryleung
Reviews.Content: overall the hotel staff is friendly and professional..... parking can be a problem in some way if there is alot of customers with cars... very busy intersection however the noise level is low

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: heads_up
Reviews.Content: The hotel is more than what I expected from a property under the Comfort Inn brand. The rooms are well appointed and clean, plus the staff is very helpful. Overall, the hotel is great. However, a few important things to consider that may turn some people off: 1) It's located in Vancouver's entertainment district. 2) There is a night club in the basement and pub on the main floor of the hotel. Avoid getting a room on one of the lower floors as it can be loud at night. On this trip I stayed in a room directly above the pub and found it to be too noisy as I could hear the band playing all night until the pub closed, but on other trips I stayed on higher floors and had no problems. 3) There is no fitness facility and the neighborhood isn't ideal for an evening run (it's a late night entertainment district).

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, too bad about the noise”
Reviews.Author: jaykay99
Reviews.Content: Decent location - the immediate surroundings are slightly rough, but the hotel is within easy walking distance of some really nice shopping areas. The interior of the hotel was much nicer than the exterior. My room was especially cute and comfortable. Too bad about the noise - the band in the adjoining bar played until at least 1 a.m. (on a Monday night), and I could hear it quite clearly. On the plus side, the continental breakfast the next morning was ample.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Economy”
Reviews.Author: Sandy317
Reviews.Content: Not many hotels allow five in a room, so we appreciated the Comfort Inn. If economy is more important to you than a spacious room or beautiful view, this is the hotel for you. The beds are new and comfortable, the bathroom clean and newly redone , the free breakfast is plentiful and you can sit and read the paper as long as you like, and the staff makes you feel like their most important guest. The side street, Granville, is one of the least attractive streets in Vancouver, but no one will bother you and the noise didn't reach our room on the fifth floor. The hotel staff is security conscious, and the nightclub uses a separate entrance. We walked and used Translink, there's no use for a car in this city. We had dinner at Doolin's -- the Irish Nachos were great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mel_nz_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was difficult to find, mainly due to construction and one way streets. Once we found the hotel it was in a very good location in the cnetre of town, we were able to spend the afternoon walking all around town and back to the hotel without a problem. We chose this particular hotel for the jacuzzi and the ensuite jacuzzi was very nice but the room was smaller than expected and the bed not very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was very good, large assortment and plenty of space. service was good. while we were checking out there was a couple checking in and they were being rather rude to the receptionist and telling the receptionist that he knew nothing. I was impressed with how the receptionist handled this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Would totally stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler1000
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish place. Our room was enormous, with a sofa and chairs and a desk and two big beds, windows in two directions and plenty of walking around space. The bathroom was cool with a pedestal sink. Decor was colorful, sleek, yet cheerful and clean at the same time. Loved it. Breakfast at the pub next door was great. Beds were super-duper comfy. Mattresses were Beautyrest pillowtops - Classic. (Yes, I checked. I'm buying the same for my next mattress) I've stayed in a lot of downtown hotels and the rooms tend to be hobbit-sized and priced for royalty. Not this place. Excellent value and a very nice walk down to Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “No idea what to expect, but thoroughly enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: April-holiday
Reviews.Content: My stay here was unplanned and I chose it simply because it was the first hotel I saw. However, I do not regret staying here at all and would stay here again. My room was clean and comfortable. Even a bath in the bathroom which was lovely. There is a lot of construction working going on nearby, however, I could not hear anything from my room. Walking distance to Robinson street and Yaletown. There is only one lift in the hotel, so sometimes it took awhile to come however, this was not really a major problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bucajack
Reviews.Content: Checked in early and got upgraded to a king suite with a jacuzzi. Very nice and spacious room. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is fantastic. Right in the heart of Yaletown. Great bars and restaurants within walking distance. Shopping on Robinson and Georgia Streets is only a 4-5 minute walk away. Only drawback is the guest parking is $16 per night with taxes. Tip: although breakfast may be included try the Elbow Room on Davie and Seymour. Fantastic breakfast and great fun! The two guys that own it are heavily involved in the gay scene in Vancouver and can't resist calling all the customers girls!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: KER_1952
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews say it all. Good location. Big clean rooms with spa bath. Friendly and helpfull staff. Good pub below. Great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Awesome breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: bombini
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. We booked a room with king size bed and a "2-person whirlpool," which turned out to be just a large 1 person jacuzzi. There was also free high-speed internet in the room. Parking is in an outdoor lot and costs $14 plus tax per day. The parking lot is reserved for exclusively for hotel guests at night. The parking lot was well lit and there was a security guard in the lot at night. I loved breakfast, which included fruit, cereal, scones, muffins, bagels, toast, coffee, tea, juice, and my favorite part, make your own waffles. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and have no hesitation recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: loved1
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Comfort Inn for our first night in Vancouver, as it was only going to be one night before heading to Seattle. The room was cheap and was on the second level. Could not here the night club from here - we requested a room away from the night club - which was great. Room came with free breakfast, which was located in the pub downstairs. Breakfast was excellent, had selection of cereals, waffles, fruit, bagels etc. The decor in the rooms was a little dated, but for the cost was excellent. Location was excellent. Right downtown. Looked like there were a number of night clubs around as seemed like a very popular spot for night life. I would definitely stay there again if I wasnt there to spend the night in my room. We basically just slept in there and that was it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the breakfast :)”
Reviews.Author: mjc11
Reviews.Content: Great choice to stay. Convenient location downtown. It's not a 'shotty' part of town but there's definitely some night life happening. The pizza place across the street is excellent for a snack after your concert or hockey game. The walk to GM Place is about 10 or 15 minutes. The rooms are clean and updated. Great bed linens. Our room even had a comfy couch. The breakfast is excellent. I love 'make your own waffle'! And great coffee too. Not sure if they have an alternate entrance for people with disabilities though, there's a lot of steps to the front desk. As long as you're not expecting the Ritz I would reccommend the Comfort Inn Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunwor
Reviews.Content: I read many of the other reviews, looked at the pictures and then nervously decided on this budget hotel. We could not have been happier. First, we had asked for a quiet part of the hotel. They put us on the top floor near the back(room 405) We never heard a peep. Extremely quiet. They upgraded our bed to a queen and we had not even asked. We paid $65.00, and this included a very nice breakfast, free paper, internet in the lobby and a great downtown location. A lot of the other reviews had mentioned that the area was a bit sketchy. We did not even have an issue with that. I thought the area was fine. Never at all felt unsafe. Extremely good value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - shame about the area”
Reviews.Author: sazzyb8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights - was very impressed overall. Booked a double room which included private bathroom,cable, free local phone calls and a great breakfast (cereal, bagels, toast, waffles, tea, coffee, juice) Room was very clean, (offered to clean it every morning) staff are very helpful and friendly. The only negative was the location - didn't feel too comfortable going out at night as it is off Granville Street which isn't the best area. Overall I would thoroughly recommend it for a short stay - just be wary at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LeeWashington
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver for a concert at General Motors Place and picked this hotel for location and price. Location was convenient to shopping, restaurants, waterfront and GM place. All within a 20 minute walk. Price was very reasonable. We parked our car on site for $14.00/day and walked everywhere. Stayed here 2 nights and had an overall good experience. The neighborhood towards evening may get shady, but hotel had pesence of security and no problem there. Backpackers hostel close by and our room looked over to it, like within feet. We just pulled the blinds and had no problem. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, bathroom spotless. Saturday night was noisy from nightclub music below. May want to request a higher level room, our was on 2nd floor, if you think that would keep you up.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: WolfgangConstanze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn downtown for two nights before leaving on a cruise to Alaska. The neighbourhood is a little "sketchy" as you drive up, but once you walk a block or two off Granville street it is much more tourist friendly. Our room was quite small, but very comfortable, especially the bed. Bathroom and shower were both clean and quite new looking. Hallways are very brightly lit and also clean. Staff was accomodating and pleasant - not too helpful in recommending restaurants however. There was some noise from nearby rooms and other guests, as well we could slightly hear the music from the pub that is in the hotel. It didn't really bother us, but if you're noise sensitive you might want to think about this. Great location for shopping and restaurants - $14/night for parking. We didn't have a car (and didn't need one). The free continental breakfast was excellent - hard boiled eggs, make your own waffles as well as the usual bagels, toast etc. Coffee was quite good! We also liked the free wireless internet - very convenient. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I Felt Spoilt!”
Reviews.Author: sleepydumpling
Reviews.Content: Was staying with friends in BC, but had to stay the last night in a hotel to make a ridiculously early bus to Seattle. Booked the Comfort Inn after a friend recommended them, and I also liked the price. Booked in and the staff were very friendly (she was an Aussie!) and went up to the room, which was gorgeous. Not huge, but for one night I didn't need it to be. Beautifully made up, lovely decor that made me feel luxurious. After coming back from dinner decided to have a bath and watch some TV before hitting the hay. The bathroom was immaculately clean, and lots of hot water and a big tub. The bed was big, comfy and had lots of pillows and luxurious linen on it (I am a linen snob). Slept like a log, got a wakeup call at 4am to meet aforementioned ridiculously early bus. Staff were lovely at checkout despite it being 4.30am and called me a taxi, AND loaded my bags into the cab. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the Comfort Inn!”
Reviews.Author: bitsycat
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stay at the Comfort Inn. The rooms (we stayed in two thanks to a free upgrade) were exceptionally clean, well equipped and comfortable. The free breakfast was great and the staff were all helpful and friendly. Granville Street is very loud and busy but is generally safe (I was impressed by the police presence at the weekend). I had been worried about the location but there are a lot of homeless people/ vagrants throughout Vancouver and beside some of the swankier hotels too so this was not an issue. I actually felt safer there because there is so much going on on Granville. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “One for clubbers”
Reviews.Author: Donza29
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that any hotel in Downtown Vancouver is going to be disadvantaged simply by being in downtown Vancouver. Downtown Vancouver is just out and out dodgy. Expect to be asked for money numerous times throughout the day and even more at night. The hotel itself is fine, nothing special but there was nothing wrong with it either. A huge plus for us was the free internet - we were doing an around the world trip and were blogging as we went. Another really big plus was the friendly staff. They were very obliging and they made stay as enjoyable as possible. The hotel itself sits above Doolins Irish Pub, which is both a pro and a con. There are lots of fast food or takeaway joints near the motel, but very few restaurants. So Doolins is a good option for food. However you must get in early otherwise you won't get a seat. This place packs em in as the night progresses. And sitting below Doolins is the Cellar nightclub which stays open untill the wee hours of the morn. We stayed on level 1 and I have to admit, we didn't hear as much 'doof doof' as we expected. On Friday and Saturday nights, the police close the roads at 9pm to let the clubbers have free reign. This causes confusion when getting public transport or a taxi back to the motel. My recommendation - if you're going to stay in Dowtown Vancouver, don't stay in the entertainment district unless you're there to hit the pubs and clubs. But if you must stay in the entertainment district (along Granville Street) then you could do a lot worse than the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Australianchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and had the cheap Queen bedroom - everything was nice and clean. It was nothing fancy, but perfect for what we wanted. The room was very small - only enough room for the bed, some furniture, and enough room to walk around, but it was fine. The bed was comfortable and bedding ok. The furnishings were a litle garish (red + leopard print) but hey, each to their own. The bathroom was huge and had a feature spa bath! We didn't experience any noise problems in our room. Location was great, everything was easily within walking distance and we didn't feel the neighbourhood was unsafe at all. The breakfast at the Irish pub underneath the hotel was great, they had make your own waffles which was a highlight. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ajones6
Reviews.Content: Very cute decor and great location. Staff was helpful and friendly. Clean rooms. Our room was very small, but we booked a "One Queen Bed" room at a discounted rate. It was perfect for what we were using it for, which was sleeping, but if you're planning to spend a lot of time in your room, invest in a larger room. The location couldn't be better. It's right in the middle of downtown and there is a bus stop on the corner. We did see a couple of hookers on the corner late one night, but we had no problems. There is a pub on the ground floor and they serve breakfast there every morning. Keep in mind that there are lots of homeless people in downtown Vancouver- but it's everywhere. In my opinion, if you are there to sight see, just buy a pack of bus passes at 711 and skip the cabs until you have to. Public transportation is easy in Vancouver. There are buses, skytrain, and seabus (ferry) and they all use the same tickets. $2.50 for one zone ticket and $3.75 for two zones. There is a website where you punch in your starting location and where you want to go and it will map out your trip for you. **Be sure to try out the MegaBite Pizza place.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: tracyk88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from a Thursday to Saturday. The rooms were surprisngly large and well decorated. Unfortunately the design of the lobby makes it difficult to carry up large luggage because there are no ramps to roll up so you have to carry all your bags up the short flights of stairs. The only other problem I had with the hotel was that it was noisy at night. My window faced out to the main street and I could hear music and the deep bass beats all night. Fortunately I brought ear plugs, so I was able to sleep but I would recommend all future visitors to also bring them! Otherwise, the staff were great and accommodating and there were no other problems. The complimentary breakfast was sparse but I enjoyed the waffles. All in all, if you can tolerate a bit of noise at night, this hotel is a great deal and in a convenient location!

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 654 Nelson Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6B 6K4, Canada
